content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md_content::String)
    # Parse the markdown document
    parsed_md = parse(md_content)

    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted Julia code
    julia_code = ""

    # Iterate over the markdown elements
    for (i, el) in enumerate(parsed_md.content)
        # Check if the element is a code block and if it's Julia language
        if typeof(el) == Markdown.Code && el.language == "julia"
            # Remove code fences and append the code to the string
            julia_code *= replace(el.code, r"^```julia\n|\n```$" => "") * "\n"
        end
    end

    # Remove the trailing newline and return the extracted Julia code
    return chomp(julia_code)
end
```
